caption: **WARNING*** DO NOT EAT HERE This place is a joke. I sat down and ordered food. We were the only ones in the restaurant. When the food came out it was the wrong order. The lady owner then was extremely rude to me! I then asked for a togo container. She said they don't have anything because of covid. After I watched her do to go containers for two others, for to go orders.  This place is rude and too cheap to give you a togo container for your left overs.
Been here a few times, and they are pretty consistent.  Food is good, and so is the service.

Definitely one of the best pho spots in Henderson, but covid-19 has definitely made things difficult for the owners. I’m sure customer service will be much better when the pandemic is over and they feel safe to talk to their customers.
This is a hard working family with great food! It is worth the wait!!!

My friend and I stood at the table to order for 15 min without being acknowledged There is 1 server 1 busboy 1 cook The server is extremely rude A lot of customers just walked out My main issue is the rudeness Everywhere you go in Henderson or Las Vegas never have I encountered anything like this We don't need that during a pandemic smh

Always looking for great Pho and found it here! Littler interesting measures in place for covid but always nice to know they are taking precautions which means safer environment. I ordered the chicken pho and the broth was 5 stars all on its own. My daughter got the chicken fried rice and it was just as good! The couple working didn’t know much English, but everything was correct when it came out and they were very nice. Will return again for sure!
This is the typical mom and pop set up. Their Pho is hands down the best I've ever had. They also have appetizers that are excellent as well.

Visiting friends in Vegas and dropped in for dinner.  Food was fantastic and  the restaurant/restrooms were extremely clean. Service was typical for a mom and pop owned Asian restaurant.  As one would expect, COVID has caused them to put interesting measures in place to protect themselves and their customers. Rules are clearly written in English on the door entering the restaurant and at the table. This helped in setting our expectations prior to committing. They took a more stringent approach to protect everyone (as compared to other restaurants we dined) and we appreciated the effort.  Food was well priced for the proportions and tasted great!  It was apparent that the two people who were working were not well versed in English, but they tried their best. The lady took our order, repeated it back to ensure accuracy and we received what we ordered. From the time we sat down to the time we received our order was about 15 minutes.  We will definitely visit again!

I do not recommend this business on basic principles of economics. They will NOT allow you to take food home, as to-go containers are reserved for to-go orders only. The food was good, which is the only reason they even received 2 stars, but don't come here if you want good service and unless you're hungry enough to be in the clean plate club.

Service is just as important as the quality of your food. We walked in, were poorly greeted & waited 10 minutes for absolutely nothing. No one came to take drink orders or even to say we'll be right with you. Nothing. There were only 2 other tables with customers and 1 already had their food. 1 star cause 0 is not an option. It may be delicious, but now we will never know
This restaurant does not use fresh noodles. The noodles come from individual packets, a lot like bulk ramen noodles from the grocery store.  Friendly service ✔ Decent prices ✔

Used to be one of our favorite places. Went in to have dine in as absolutely no one was in the restaurant also called before to request reservation. I was told over the phone 15-20min was good for dine in. After walking in, greeted with “what do you want.” Secondly informing we called in to request done in, she pointed at a table and said sit I’ll come after packing orders. After 15 min of sitting no one came to us. Literally we were the only 2 people in restaurant. Then when we did ask if we order online, call or how to order the lady informed us I’m to busy with to go orders I’ll come when I can. Immediately came to our table and first thing said to us was “I don’t know when you will get your food we are to busy.” I have never left a bad review as I previously worked in the service industry, but as the only people in your restaurant you would think customer service would be different. Very disappointed and won’t be going back.
Very good food and service, delicious!
Great food, fresh and delicious.
Small hidden gem located in the walmart shopping center. The food is very delicious, authentic taste. So glad we've found this place. Highly recommend it!

2nd time I've been there and I like it. I appreciate the staff doing their best to follow CDC guidelines while staying open. Their food portions are generous for the price and have a good balanced flavor. We leave full every time.

We ate here last week because we needed to hit up the Galleria Mall. Drove from IKEA. Googled and found this place. Decided to try it because I REALLY wanted pho. We typically get our pho from Pho Kim Long and we’re picky on broth since we’re Asian and can make it at home. Anyway, once we got there we were greeted by an older woman (maybe owner?). As other diners said, reception wasn’t very warm. We (family of 4) were the only diners around 3:15 pm.  Ordered: 1 combo pho 1 well-done beef pho 1 order of spring rolls 1 combo fried rice  It took about 10 minutes to get our spring rolls. The kids loved it. I am obsessed with their spring roll sauce. Best we’ve had so far in Vegas! It’s got a slight spicy kick to it and it’s not super thick. Would order this again for sure.  Hubby loved his combo pho. I LOVE their broth! Omg. It’s got a sweeter kick to it and I love that! I didn’t add any hoisin or sriracha. Meat was plentiful (I notice Pho Kim Long meat and noodle portions are VERY small for what they consider a large size - ugh). I’m amazed at the pho broth quality here. I’d eat here more regularly if it wasn’t 30 minutes away!  Combo fried rice was delicious but not a lot of meat, which was surprising. Maybe 6 pieces of shrimp total but the other meats were minced. It was like a fried rice with small bits or chicken or beef (smaller than the size of a pea).  That was the only disappointment but the flavor was definitely there.  5/5 for the pho and spring rolls. Towards the end of our dining experience the older lady was warmer in personality. Would definitely come back in the future. Just wish we didn’t live so far away. What a great hidden gem in Henderson!!
Learn customer service, thats so disrespectful having customers call on the phone and your answering it right there. Come up to the table take the order, we are safe wearing our masks.
Don't come in during c-covid 19 service is rude order out only.

They are VERY rude and has ZERO customer service...they treated my husband and I like we were diseased or something... no one acknowledged us... they didn't want to take our order... and just plain RUDE!! IF YOU'RE AFRICAN AMERICAN....DONT EAT HERE!!
Great food.
Teriyaki beef, pork rolls and beef pho -take out🙂 $23 after 20% off. Styrofoam container for soup cracked but didn’t spill.
amazing pho and sweet staff.

Only had the boba milk tea and the boba slush. They were both tasty especially the boba blueberry slush ★★★★ They're definitely not the warmest or friendliest... I think an order kiosk would have been warmer...so go for the food/drinks as long as you don't care about attitude 😉
So good! I love this place. The pho is amazing and it has a very home type feeling. Service is excellent and fast. Staff is super warm and friendly!!
Love it
It's like noodles from heaven!! 💯
Super clean and pretty large portions for the price. Service was Excellent. Glad I finally have pho closer to me now. Driving from lake Las Vegas into the city was a mission
The food is hot and has great flavor. My favorite spot for lunch and dinner.

Food is bad and sevice is worst .tje old lady treat us bad from the bigining, sje look at our skeen color and sje presume  that we were there to do something to her Never again come back to this place
Search nice owners with good service and good food
Loved it kids loved it people were friendly seems very clean I very much enjoyed the restaurant
Best Pho in East Henderson.
Very good food and nice little couple running the place

ordered take out. shrimp spring rolls, rare steak pho and grilled pork sandwich. all very good. service was spectatcular. opemed the door for me on the way out, because we had a lot of food. would recommend.
Slow service,bad communication skills,food is not done right
(Translated by Google) Excellent pho!  (Original) Отличный фо!
(Translated by Google) Very tasty and fast  (Original) Очень вкусно и быстро
Yummy!!   Kind service.   Great food and take out had everything we needed in the bag!
Terrific find! Family run, large portions, reasonably priced. Try the "crispy pot stickers"!
I had the combo pho and pot stickers. That was very good. I barely finished it all. Didn't realize i was ordering so much. I'll definitely be back.
The Pho was very good and the place was clean and nice with very good service.
Was absolutely wonderful!
The food was delicious great, the portions were generous and the interior is gorgeous. The boba and milk teas (especially taro) were so good. No complaints
Good food, good prices, good service!
Great food,  and plenty to take home.
Good food. Price is good. Sandwiches could be a bit bigger for the price.
First time here! I always have to drive far to get Pho but I’m so happy that this place is closer! Great food and friendly people!

Nice, clean interior. Its actually surprising how nice it is inside because of the plain, low key exterior of the place. I walked in and was delighted to see it was so nice. Then I tried the egg rolls and man, delicious. A little pricey at almost 8 bucks for 4 egg rolls but DELICIOUS all the same. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
Very clean. The food was delicious!

We were pleasantly surprised when we  stopped in this place after passing by a few times. It's a nice family owned business. We started with the spring rolls and calamari. Both were delicious. The calamari was salt and pepper style. And the spring rolls were very fresh tasting.  I had the tendon pho. The beef broth was just amazingly delicious. It had seven spice seasoning with just the right amount of star anise. The tendon was cooked until it was so tender. The wife had the shrimp with rice noodles. It came with this fish sauce which was slightly sweet and salty . When you poured it on top, it elevated the flavors. She loved it. And loved the fact that they had gluten free noodles. They also have vegan options.  The service was very friendly. I spoke to the chef, he was very nice and very appreciative when we told him how great everything was.  We will definitely be back. There isn't a place to get great pho for at least 10 miles.  And if you are coming from the other side of town, it's worth the drive!  We live to see small businesses thrive and I can see this place being very successful
Ask for more jalopanos

It was Very Good! Glad they finally opened! Been waiting for a good Pho place and I think I've found it. I Had the number 17 Combination Phoad that was great! Can't wait to try some of their other dishes. Will definitely be back.

New kid on the block so I decided to give them a try. Was not disappointed. Spring rolls were fresh and delicious and the seafood pho was what I expected. Only thing I wish they would do is slice the jalapenos thinner. Dislike biting into a big slice of spicy pepper.
One of the best I've tried in the entire Las Vegas Valley.

I had the seafood pho and it was chocked full of shrimp, fish balls, white fish, and squid. The broth was slightly spicy, which I love. Prices were standard, about $11.00 per bowl with lots of noodles. Will be back.
Pho was good
Great food and atmosphere.
it was a lovely place to eat! hope it can find big success soon!

Fuzen is good, I'm happy to see a Pho place on this side of town.  It's great to get my Pho fix without having to drive across the Valley.  With that said, yes there are better spots, but I will definitely be back here simply because it's good and its local!
Great food and a straight forward menu! It's nice to have a pho restaurant in old Henderson.
The thai tea was bomb 😋

I've had lots of pho in my life...and I wonder if the good reviews were made by family or friends. The portions were TERRIBLE. Like....when I say terrible, I mean the pho portions embarrassingly small. The quality wasn't bad, not great but I've had worse. I honestly felt kind of bad because this is a new place and they are not going to get repeat customers unless they work on their portions. I know I wont be back unfortunately.

I went in for take-out today a was delightfully pleased by this restaurant.  Very clean, lovely decor, and absolutely wonderfully polite staff who went above and beyond. Though I only ordered to-go, I was seated and offered ice water, which was much appreciated!  On the way out, the sweet woman from behind the counter handed me my food and and then ran ahead to open the door for me.  Such exceptional customer service.  Food was also very good - I went with the veggie pho with the veggie broth instead of beef and was pleased!  Not too extensive of a menu, but you can definitely find the staples of what you are looking for. Portions are well sized in my opinion and worth the price.  I am looking forward to visiting again in the future!

There are few places in town that can do Pho right. The people who run this restaurant know how Pho is suppose to made and they do it right. With multiple different types, all with great flavor. The staff are kind and attentive. This is by far, the best Pho you can get in Henderson.
Amazing place. Food is really good, so much flavor highly recommended.

This is my go-to for Pho.  I get the combination Pho and it's spot on every time.  Friendly service and personable staff make this a wonderful experience to try out or become a regular at.  I hope they stay open forever.
Really nice restaurant. Bigger than allot of other Vietnamese restaurants. Clean. Good eats.
This is the second time we were there. First, with my wife and liked it so this time we brought our daughter. We'll be back many more times. Good food.

Food tastes great. Inside ambience is nice. However, because of the window coverings, it’s hard to tell if they are open or not. Portions are smaller than other Pho places we’ve been to here in LV/Henderson. Host/waitress can show a little bit more friendliness. I hope the place stays as clean as it is now.

Such a tranquil and light casual restaurant atmosphere with great food and service. The food was exactly perfect. I like a little more veggies with the pho (right when served as I'm used to as from other pho restaurants I've visited), but I requested more bean sprouts, etc, and she brought more without any hesitation.  The pho itself was so delicious. She brought a bowl for my husband too to share, even tho I didn't even ask! That was very appreciated. Pot stickers were yum!!! Great prices too. Highly recommended.

Owners are super friendly. Best Pho I've had in a long time. We haven't eaten any local Pho since my husband became sick eating at one on Eastern.  You can tell the broth is fresh and vegetables were crisp.  We'll be ordering some rice and vermicelli dishes tonight.  😁

Been waiting for this place to open forever now! Hoping it gets lots of business because their pho is great! I had the Rare Steak Pho and they give you generous amounts of meat, combined with a really great broth and your typical rice noodles. Seriously, the broth is SO good I didnt even need or want to add any sriracha, soy sauce, or anything!  The only few downsides are the fact their menus are printed out on paper and dont have their drinks listed, but I just assume it's because they're brand new and may be waiting on them. The pho is about a dollar more expensive than the other shops closer to/in Vegas, but that's no matter for me since it's so close to my home and the pho is great quality.  Overall, fantastic offerings. Can't wait to see where they go from from here.
God bless there is finally a Pho restaurant here in old Henderson. Tried them and so far they are not bad. Will come back and hopefully they stick around.
Delicious food and super friendly hosts
Great place, amazing environment, great service. Food is delicious! It's a must check out!
We have been waiting for this place to open. We ordered combination pho, vegetable pho, chicken pho and spring rolls. It was delicious!! Definitely will come back and try the rice dishes..
Great new pho restaurant in the neighborhood.  Don't have to go all the way to Spring Mountain area. Will try rice dishes next time. Excellent food service! Will definitely come back!

Great new pho place in Henderson. I got the combination pho and it did not disappoint! I'd also recommend getting the Thai tea. Service is also great unlike a lot of pho places. The owners are super friendly and nice. Its definitely worth checking out!
